stem: A patient at 36 weeks gestation with known preeclampsia begins to have a tonic-clonic seizure. Which action is the absolute priority during the active seizure?

options.text: Insert a padded tongue blade to prevent tongue biting.
Turn the patient onto their left side and ensure head safety.
Notify the provider to prepare for an emergency C-section.
Administer a 4 gram IV bolus of Magnesium Sulfate.

rationale.correct: Safety and airway protection are the priority during any active seizure. Turning the patient to the side prevents aspiration of secretions.
rationale.incorrect: Magnesium sulfate is the drug of choice to stop/prevent further seizures but is administered AFTER the immediate safety of the airway is secured. Padded tongue blades are outdated and dangerous. Delivery is the ultimate cure, but the mother must be stabilized first.

answerBreakdown.label: A
answerBreakdown.content: Choosing "Insert a padded tongue blade to prevent tongue biting." represents a misinterpretation of the gathered cues or a failure to prioritize physiological needs.

answerBreakdown.label: B
answerBreakdown.content: Clinically, "Turn the patient onto their left side and ensure head safety." is the most appropriate finding pointing toward the suspected condition and requiring intervention.

answerBreakdown.label: C
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Notify the provider to prepare for an emergency C-section." might delay more critical interventions, as it does not address the immediate life-threatening risk.

answerBreakdown.label: D
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Administer a 4 gram IV bolus of Magnesium Sulfate." might delay more critical interventions, as it does not address the immediate life-threatening risk.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: While Magnesium is the specific treatment for Eclampsia, the 'Standard Seizure Rule' (Safety/Side-lying) still applies first.

mnemonic.title: S-I-D-E
mnemonic.expansion: Safety, Isolate from harm, Delivery prep later, Epinephrine NOT used (Mag is).

reviewUnits.heading: Advanced Study: Eclampsia
reviewUnits.body: Focus on the pathophysiology, assessment cues, and priority interventions associated with eclampsia. Ensure you can distinguish it from similar differential diagnoses.
